text: [Time for a personal remark!] (staring at Alice) Your hair wants cutting.
[Let's change the subject with a riddle.] (wide-eyed) Why is a raven like a writing-desk?
[Oh dear, I'm so nervous.] (enters with a teacup and bread-and-butter) I beg pardon, your Majesty, for bringing these in; but I hadn't quite finished my tea when I was sent for.
[I'm not sure, maybe the others remember?] (looks at March Hare) Fourteenth of March, I think it was.
[Oh no, he's noticed my hat.] It isn't mine.
[I must explain quickly.] I keep them to sell. I've none of my own. I'm a hatter.
